isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL CONTROL SYSTEM

svcproc.title: ELECTRICAL CONTROL SYSTEM
svcproc.para: The lift axle control systems contain both pneumatic and electrical components. This section describes the electrical components of the control system used in the lift axle system. The operation of the pneumatic controls is described in the sections covering each axle type; FIXED AXLE ASSEMBLIES , or SELF-STEERING AXLE ASSEMBLIES . Removal and installation procedures for all axle mounted control components are located in the sections covering each axle type. Removal and installation procedures for all cab mounted control components are located in the REMOVAL and INSTALLATION sections in this section.
The lift axle electrical system consists of the following components:

item.para: the reverse lift relay - (only on systems with self-steering axles)

svcproc.para: The function of the electrical control circuit is to select the state of the electrically controlled air solenoid that routes supply air to either the lift bags or the load bags. The following list indicates the figures containing the schematic diagrams, and connector location diagrams, for the various lift axle configurations.

svcproc.para:
When the ignition is switched on, power for the lift axle circuit is routed from fuse F29, in fuse block 3, to terminals A and B of connector 1019. Ground for the control circuit is supplied to terminal C of connector 1019. Refer to the following OPERATION section
for a detailed description of the electrical control system during each axle operation.
